thread.title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds youngster Ryan Kent set for £2.5million Leeds switch?
thread.title_full: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds youngster Ryan Kent set for £2.5million Leeds switch?

author: James Whaling
title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds youngster Ryan Kent set for £2.5million Leeds switch?
text:
Kent during his loan spell at Barnsley (Photo: Rex) Share Get Liverpool FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leeds United are plotting a £2.5million summer raid for Liverpool youngster Ryan Kent. 
That is according to The Sun, who say Whites boss Garry Monk has been impressed with Kent's form during his loan spell with Barnsley. 
The 20-year-old is apparently happy to stay at Oakwell for the remainder of the season, after which promotion-chasing Leeds could pounce. 
If Jurgen Klopp does decide to cash in, the Elland Road outfit will reportedly head the queue for his services. Hull 2-0 Liverpool View gallery 
Liverpool's awful start to 2017 continued as Alfred N'Diaye scored on his Hull debut to condemn the Reds to a fourth defeat in five games. 
Jurgen Klopp's side were mugged at the KCOM Stadium as they failed to turn their domination into three points and they conceded a soft goal through a Simon Mignolet error before on loan Everton striker Oumar Niasse sealed Hull's victory. 
The Reds have failed to win any of their first five league game at the start of a year since 1954 - when they were last relegated from the top flight. 
Their rotten start to the year has ended their hopes of silverware and it will also cost them a top four place if they do not arrest it soon. 
Here are five things we learned, courtesy of Mirror Football's David Anderson. Klopp: We're producing our own problems Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
